item.title: Stephen add a quote by Vaclav Havel
item.description: "Hope is not a feeling of certainty that everything ends well. Hope is just a feeling that life and work have a meaning." -- Vaclav Havel

item.title: Stephen add a quote by Vaclav Havel
item.description: "Hope is not the conviction that something will turn out well, but the certainty that something makes sense, regardless of how it turns out." -- Vaclav Havel

item.title: Stephen add a quote by Vaclav Havel
item.description: "Keep the company of those who seek the truth- run from those who have found it" -- Vaclav Havel

item.title: Stephen add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Stephen add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "The very least you can do in your life is figure out what you hope for. And the most you can do is live inside that hope. Not admire it from a distance but live right in it, under its roof." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Stephen add a quote by Richard Hughes
item.description: "Do your bit to save humanity from lapsing back into barbarity by reading all the novels you can." -- Richard Hughes

item.title: Stephen add a quote by Washington Irving
item.description: "A mother is the truest friend we have, when trials heavy and sudden fall upon us; when adversity takes the place of prosperity; when friends desert us; when trouble thickens around us, still will she cling to us, and endeavor by her kind precepts and counsels to dissipate the clouds of darkness, and cause peace to return to our hearts." -- Washington Irving

item.title: Stephen add a quote by Stanley Kunitz
item.description: "The universe is a continuous web. Touch it at any point and the whole web quivers." -- Stanley Kunitz

item.title: Stephen add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Happiness consists in getting enough sleep. Just that, nothing more." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Stephen add a quote by Gregory Maguire
item.description: "People who claim that they're evil are usually no worse than the rest of us... It's people who claim that they're good, or any way better than the rest of us, that you have to be wary of." -- Gregory Maguire

item.title: Stephen add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "Unexpected intrusions of beauty. This is what life is." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: Stephen add a quote by William Styron
item.description: "A great book should leave you with many experiences, and slightly exhausted at the end. You live several lives while reading." -- William Styron

item.title: Stephen add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "It's really a wonder that I haven't dropped all my ideals, because they seem so absurd and impossible to carry out. Yet I keep them, because in spite of everything, I still believe that people are really good at heart." -- Anne Frank

item.title: Stephen add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "We must be free not because we claim freedom, but because we practice it." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Stephen add a quote by Wisława Szymborska
item.description:
"When I pronounce the word Future, the first syllable already belongs to the past.
When I pronounce the word Silence, I destroy it." -- Wisława Szymborska

item.title: Stephen add a quote by Glen Cook
item.description: "Morning is wonderful. Its only drawback is that it comes at such an inconvenient time of day." -- Glen Cook

item.title: Stephen add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "Always try to keep a patch of sky above your life." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Stephen add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Rather than love, than money, than fame, give me truth." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Stephen add a quote by William Makepeace Thackeray
item.description: "Good humor may be said to be one of the very best articles of dress one can wear in society." -- William Makepeace Thackeray

item.title: Stephen add a quote by Jean Kerr
item.description: "I make mistakes; I'll be the second to admit it." -- Jean Kerr

item.title: Stephen add a quote by Vladimir Mayakovsky
item.description: "A line is a fuse that's lit. The line smolders, the rhyme explodes— and by a stanza a city is blown to bits." -- Vladimir Mayakovsky

item.title: Stephen add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "I'm going to smile, and my smile will sink down into your pupils, and heaven knows what it will become." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Stephen add a quote by Frank McCourt
item.description: "You might be poor, your shoes might be broken, but your mind is a palace." -- Frank McCourt

item.title: Stephen add a quote by Francois Mauriac
item.description: "If you would tell me the heart of a man, tell me not what he reads, but what he rereads." -- Francois Mauriac

item.title: Stephen add a quote by John Grisham
item.description: "In life, finding a voice is speaking and living the truth. Each of you is an original. Each of you has a distinctive voice. When you find it, your story will be told. You will be heard." -- John Grisham

item.title: Stephen add a quote by Lillian Hellman
item.description: "I cannot and will not cut my conscience to fit this year's fashions." -- Lillian Hellman

item.title: Stephen add a quote by Betty Friedan
item.description: "Aging is not 'lost youth' but a new stage of opportunity and strength." -- Betty Friedan

item.title: Stephen add a quote by William Gibson
item.description: "The future is there... looking back at us. Trying to make sense of the fiction we will have become." -- William Gibson

item.title: Stephen add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "She looked at nice young men as if she could smell their stupidity." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Stephen add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "I can shake off everything as I write; my sorrows disappear, my courage is reborn." -- Anne Frank
